content.text: To foster strong, collaborative partnerships with parents and the wider community, recognizing that student success is maximized when schools and families work together towards shared educational goals.
Eduversal schools maintain open, two-way communication channels to ensure parents are well-informed and engaged.

content.title: Standard Channels
items: School Management System (EduNav): For grades, attendance, and direct messaging.
Weekly/Monthly Newsletters: Highlighting school events, achievements, and upcoming dates.
Parent-Teacher Conferences (PTC): Scheduled at least twice per year to discuss student progress.
Coffee with Principal: Informal sessions for parents to meet leadership and discuss school-wide topics.
Social Media: Official school accounts for celebrating student life and community events.

content.text: The PTA serves as a bridge between the parent body and the school administration. It supports the school's mission through volunteerism, fundraising, and community-building events.

roles.title: Class Representatives
resp: Coordinate communication for specific grade levels

roles.title: Event Committees
resp: Plan and execute specific events like International Day, Family Fun Fair

content.text: Parents receive regular, data-driven updates on their child's academic and social development.

items.title: Termly Reports
points: Issued at the end of each term (4 times a year). Includes grades, effort scores, and teacher comments.

items.title: Progress Reports
points: Mid-term updates for students at risk or requiring specific interventions.

items.title: Student-Led Conferences (SLC)
points: An annual event where students present their portfolio of work and learning goals to their parents.

content.text: The school provides opportunities for parents to learn about the curriculum and how to support their child's learning at home.

items: Curriculum Information Sessions (e.g., Introduction to Cambridge IGCSE/A Level).
Digital Safety and Cyberbullying Workshops.
University Guidance Seminars for parents of high school students.
Parenting workshops on child development and wellbeing.

content.text: Schools actively seek partnerships with local organizations, businesses, and universities to enrich the learning experience.

items: Service Learning Projects: Collaborations with local NGOs or charities.
Internship Programs: Opportunities for senior students to gain work experience.
Guest Speakers: Inviting community leaders and experts to speak to students.

content.text: The school values feedback and has a clear procedure for addressing parental concerns constructively.

content.title: Grievance Procedure
content.purpose: To resolve issues fairly and promptly.

steps.title: Informal Resolution
steps.desc: Contact the specific teacher or staff member involved to discuss the issue directly.

steps.title: Formal Complaint to HOD/Coordinator
steps.desc: If unresolved, escalate to the Head of Department or Level Coordinator.

steps.title: Principal Review
steps.desc: Submit a formal written complaint to the Principal for investigation and final decision.

steps.title: Board Appeal
steps.desc: In exceptional cases, appeals can be made to the School Board/Foundation.

content.text: Documentation maintained to demonstrate effective engagement:

items: Parent Handbook.
Calendar of parent events and workshops.
Minutes of PTA meetings.
Samples of student reports and newsletters.
Records of parent surveys and feedback analysis.
Logs of community service and partnership activities.
CIS Standards: Domain E (Access to Teaching and Learning) and Domain F (School Culture and Partnerships).
WASC Category E: School Culture and Support for Student Personal and Academic Growth.
Indonesian National Standards: Standar Pengelolaan (Management Standard) regarding community partnership.
